sentences: Logan Conrad Mader (born November 16, 1970) is a Canadian-American record producer and current guitarist of melodic death metal band Once Human, as well as the former lead guitarist of groove metal band Machine Head.

Mader is most famous for his time in Machine Head, whose 1994 debut Burn My Eyes was released by Roadrunner Records and quickly became the top-selling debut album in the label's history until Slipknot's debut album.
Their second album, The More Things Change..., was released in 1997 and Logan left the band shortly thereafter to divert his energy and time to side projects.
Machine Head formed on October 12, 1991, with Mader on lead guitar, Robb Flynn on vocals and rhythm guitar, Adam Duce on bass and Tony Costanza on drums.
section: == Biography == | === Machine Head, Soulfly and Medication ===

sentences: He played with Machine Head through two albums until early 1998.
section: == Biography == | === Machine Head, Soulfly and Medication ===

sentences: After Mader's six-year run with the band, he joined Soulfly where he filled the slot as guitarist for their 1998 world tour.
section: == Biography == | === Machine Head, Soulfly and Medication ===

sentences: Mader's union with Soulfly was short-lived (8 months) and the only track he technically recorded with them was one of the remixes for Quilombo.
section: == Biography == | === Machine Head, Soulfly and Medication ===

sentences: Wanting to once again pursue his own projects, Mader left Soulfly in January 1999.
section: == Biography == | === Machine Head, Soulfly and Medication ===

sentences: Due to a series of internal issues, Medication disbanded in February 2003.
section: == Biography == | === Machine Head, Soulfly and Medication ===

sentences: In June, 2003, Mader formed the band New Black, which was later renamed to Stereo Black.
The song Inside (previously titled Save Me) was featured in the commercial for Max Payne, the trailer for The Butterfly Effect 2, and in the movie Never Back Down 2: The Beatdown.
Fall Again is featured in MotoGP '07 soundtrack.
Fall Again is featured in MotoGP '07 soundtrack.
In 2017, Mader dismissed Stereo Black as "just a studio project" that started for the purpose of sync licensing.
Mader announced his new project, Once Human, in May 2015, which features newcomers Lauren Hart (vocals), Damian Rainauld (bass) and Ralph Alexander (drums).
section: == Biography == | === Return to live music and further production work ===

sentences: The group signed to earMUSIC and released their debut album, The Life I Remember, in September 2015.
section: == Biography == | === Return to live music and further production work ===

sentences: In August and September 2015, they toured the southern, midwestern and southwestern United States with Fear Factory, The Bloodline and Before the Mourning.
section: == Biography == | === Return to live music and further production work ===

sentences: Mader mixed and mastered Melancholia, the debut single by French metal band ÆMBER, which was released in November 2018.
section: == Biography == | === Return to live music and further production work ===

sentences: In March 2019, it was announced that Mader (along with drummer Chris Kontos) would perform with Machine Head for the first time in 21 years with a tour celebrating the 25th anniversary of the release of Burn My Eyes; however, he and Kontos did not officially rejoin the band.
section: == Biography == | === Return to live music and further production work ===
